index_terms: CHICAGO MILWAUKEE ST PAUL PACIFIC RAILROAD
summary: An Ordinance granting to the Oregon-Washington Railroad & Navigation Company, the Great Northern Railway Company, the Northern Pacific Railway Company, and the Chicago, Milwaukee & St. Paul Railway Company, their successors and assigns, a right-of-way for, and the right, privilege and authority to locate, lay down, construct, maintain and operate until December 31, 1950, with right of modification or repeal after expiration of fourteen (14) years, sundry railway tracks in, along and across sundry streets, avenues, alleys and other public places within the City of Seattle.
